has a reputation that precedes him I'm
not going to bog this review down by

Floyd was pretty much kaput
after the final cut came out it didn't
take waters too long to start dropping
solo records and prior to the release of
this album I hadn't really given any of
it any airtime although once I dived
into it I came away pretty impressed
with just how passionately waters had
stuck to the vision that he was chasing
after during some of Floyd's golden
years in the late 70s especially on the

prepare for this new album I would
definitely recommend that that will most
likely give you the most insight to what
he's trying to do here although even if
you miss out on that it's not
necessarily a bad thing because if you
are just a hardcore floyd fan and you
know those big records you know those
classic records what waters is doing on
this new LP over here is not at all
going to feel really alien to you
because in fact I think one of my

a very much kind of a kindred spirit
to what waters is doing on this new LP
over here down to the core progressions
some of the lyrical topics and even some

this thing to the animals the bombs

the political climate that we found

vocally along with the instrumentation
and that's the thing a lot of the

you know it's very worn
it's very weary and at this point the

the greed that's poisoning our societies
or politics
that to me feels like at least part of

things take an even dreary er turn on
